website_summaries.verdict: You might like its customizable design; otherwise choose the Simplehuman if you want a top quality model.
pros: Interchangeable components make it versatile for various needs
We love its detachable knife holder
cons: It's challenging to assemble, and falls on the higher end of the price range

customer_reviews.title: The design and aesthetic are nice. Pros are all listed
customer_reviews.text: The design and aesthetic are nice. Pros are all listed in other reviews. Product gets three stars from me because: - Drain tray doesn't drain. The plastic is warped such that the lip is a good half inch higher than the floor of the tray. I plan on heating and warping the tray to fix the problem, but I shouldn't have to do this with a premium product. - Product did not ship with assembly instructions. Not a huge deal, but a few pieces we non-obvious and required comparison with pictures on the internet to see what they were supposed to do. Again, not something I would have expected in a $60+ product.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This is very badly designed. The drip tray under the rack is smaller than the rack so water drips onto the counter on all sides. The rack for the cutting board is not attached and constantly slides off. The drip tray is warped and doesn't allow the water to drain into the sink. Really disappointed for this cost.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K. Chamot

customer_reviews.title: Design fault.
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive and the drip pad is a way too short. Water doesn't drip into the sink.
customer_reviews.author: stephenwong

customer_reviews.title: Great Drying Rack
customer_reviews.text: In 2016, we were looking for the dish drying rack for a while and ended up purchasing this one. It was a great purchase. The rack is large enough to hold plates, bowls, cups and a few pots. We absolutely love it. ****2019 Update: My rack got rusted lately after heavy usage. Contacted the customer service at PremiumRack, they responded very quickly. They will send us a replace one and he did mention that in 2016, they do not have the stainless steel yet so that's why it got rusted. Love the customer service. Will absolutely purchase another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Uyen Duy Thao Phan

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product on many, many levels
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted this dish rack to work, but I was greatly disappointed. It requires a great deal of assembly, but instructions are not included. It is also too lightweight for the big job it needs to do. Clearly a poor product hiding under a layer of solicited reviews. The final insult? A large rusted box cutter blade with paper towel taped around one end (a makeshift handle) was nestled among the many pieces—a sobering sight. I know it’s just a dish rack, but I can’t help but think about conditions within factories in which products such as this are made.
customer_reviews.author: Hadley G

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical based on the assembly instructions and the way this all snaps together, and this is now going back after one use. For $60, I am very disappointed. Poor quality and design is missing some basic items of a drying rack, such as a drip pan that actually drains. 24 hours after light use, there is water still pooled in the front corners. A prime example of expensive not being an indicator of quality. The bottom part of the rack needs the slats to come up so I can actually stack things down there.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Button

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't leave too many bad reviews, but this item is just awful. I decided to spend a little more on a drainer and get this because of reviews, and man was I disappointed. 1) the pieces are flimsy 2) the drainer at the bottom doesnt cover the entire area so you will get your counter wet anyway 3) overprices for what you get. I ended up returning it and getting a drainer that was larger for much less, and is way more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Tray not large enough
customer_reviews.text: The rack is fabulous. I love the way it is organized and I can put so many more dishes in there to drain. However, I fail to understand why the tray to catch the drips that the water causes as it’s coming off of my wet dishes is not large enough to collect water. How completely ridiculous. I have this well organized sturdy drying rack and have to go out and purchase a tray to go under it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie L

customer_reviews.title: A notch above "Meh..."
customer_reviews.text: PROS: * Very sturdy * Looks better than a standard store-bought dish drainer. (It certainly should, for the price!) CONS: * The included drainage trays are essentially useless because they don't incline to drain into the sink. I bought a Rubbermaid tray that does tilt toward the sink to solve that problem. * The bottom projections that sit on the drain tray should be a little grippier somehow, so they wouldn't slip around on the tray. * Only three cupholders are provided, and they don't work very well (i.e., glasses and mugs don't really fit on them securely). Redesign needed! * I wish a stemware holder were available as an attachment. In sum, I like it but don't love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Wow, holds a TON of dishes
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a couple of months now. It holds a boatload of dishes. love the knife block feature on the side. Comes with an absorbant mat for underneath if you want to use it freestanding. Really, I am sure I am overloading it every day but this really holds an amazing amount of dishes. Love the cutting board rack (I use one nearly every day). It lets it dry completly on all sides. I am super impressed with this.
customer_reviews.author: SP BisbeeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Over designed and under engineered.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a double tier drying rack I'd used for more than 5 years. The old rack was somewhat flimsy and the attachment for drying glasses was useless. But it was much taller and held a greater variety of and more dishes. On this unit, the upper rack needs to be higher to allow the space under it to be more usable/accessible. The spacing between the wires should be closer and there should be more crossbars to allow drying smaller objects such as butter plates or plastic lids. It advertises that it is designed to be adjustable/versatile, but some of the sides are the curved; this limits where what can be attached.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Measure your counter space to make sure this rack will work for you.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve just recently received the rack so cannot vouch for its durability. As far as versatility, I’m just using it as a drying rack for my dishes. If you have a family and use lots of different pots, pan and several dishes, I don’t think there’s a dish rack big enough to hold it all. The drip is on the small side so I kept my older drip which holds the whole rack. Also, depending on your counter space, the drip pan may not actually drip into your sink, so that’s something to think about. I found it easy to assemble and it certainly seems sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Ginart

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even look for any others - this is the ONE
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I looked for months for a decent rack in many stores. We always walked away saying to each other, “Forget it, let’s just find a good one on Amazon” Well I did just that and my wife was amazed how much weight and items could be placed on this rack. I have never seen a design like this. I don’t think there is a better one out there, but I could be wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: What you receive does not add up to the absurd price I paid. Plastic drip trays are thin and warped—water won’t drain from the open one because the plastic tips up at the front. The knife and utensil holders have small drainage holes so unless you live in a desert, you’re going to have pink mold growing in them. The included drying mat has poorly finished edges so looks super cheap. And the silly side drip trays are just space wasters. The stainless steel double rack itself is just fine, if I’d paid half the price. Find something that doesn’t call itself “premium” and buy that.
customer_reviews.author: itsme

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack has lots of compartments and sections. The ones that work well, really work well. But the two layers lasted one day. I put my porcelain dishes on the top section and the plastic sides that hold them up busted in two immediately. So grateful my new plates didn't break! I tried contacting the company to ask for a replacement piece, but I never heard back, and who has the time to follow up after the initial contact request? So, I'm living (happily) without the top level.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula

customer_reviews.title: Best I could find on the market
customer_reviews.text: I really miss my old dish drainer.....it was perfect, in size, features, durability, etc! They don't make it any more. So this PremiumRacks was the closest I could find. I just wish it was a bit longer for more capacity, that the "2nd tier" was higher to allow more space beneath and, finally, that the holder for silverware was deeper as they tend to flop over rather than stand up straight-ish. But it's attractive and well-made and it works. So those are pluses.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Freeman

customer_reviews.title: I want to like it...
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this, but there’s a few flaws. The cutting board rack is on the backside which in theory works out. I guess it depends on where you place it. I have it on the counter below the cupboard. It’s really hard to get the board in the rack without going in at an angle. I liked the rack for the knife block but the slots are too small for my knives and only fits paring knives mainly. That was a major bummer. Also not sure how the water should drain from the bottom. The cup holders are not shaped to hold a cup correctly either
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: Great but pricey dishrack
customer_reviews.text: Great two tier dishrack that does what it advertises. I like the sizing of the second tier for medium/large plates, lids, boards, etc. For the price though, I had higher expectations. The first tier can be a bit more creative with spacing. It's literally just flat space. If I have lots of bowls, I have to stack them diagonally myself to save space. The drip tray does not catch water from the utensils holder. Overall if you're looking for something that's high quality and don't mind the pricing, this is great. But you'll get better value elsewhere if your budget is tighter.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty water drainage design. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The rack would be great if it weren’t for the drainage system. There’s tons of space, I like the two tiered approach, I fit an entire double sink’s worth of dishes on it but the way the water drainage is designed is abysmal. The catch pan is smaller than the rack footprint so it misses water flooding my countertop, the small catch pan is not sloped properly to drain back into the sink and the extra expansion trays hold water and don’t drain anywhere. I missed my return window or I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Timf

customer_reviews.title: Way over-hyped
customer_reviews.text: This was nothing like the "high end" dish rack it was paraded as in slick photographs and priced as. I returned it immediately. While not completely flimsy, it was definitely not super sturdy either. The pieces did not fit together in any obvious way. The two pieces of the drain tray did not fit together, and the photos were inconsistent as to whether the drain tray should be placed completely under the rack or inside the rack. There was no indication of how the micro-fiber pad was supposed to be used. In fact, it came with no instructions whatsoever, just a picture with arrows showing the parts "coming together".
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Wife is Happy so my world is happy
customer_reviews.text: My wife liked it, it was a surprise, I assembled it in about 10 minutes and it comes with extra pads, I will make the little legs a little bit longer so it will work with counter-top sinks like mine but I manage to put something on the legs and is working.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Spacious esp. for small spaces like my kitchen Can put a lot of dishes on it You can take away certain parts for more space/room Cons: For me, it a was a bit confusing trying to put together. I went off one of the pictures vs. the instructions Some parts like the cutting board holder, isn’t super sturdy I couldn’t tell how to use both draining boards together? Overall: I know it seems a bit pricey for a dish rack but I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: TiffTheStiff

customer_reviews.title: Lost some plates!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a dish rack that could handle my dinner plates. They are too deep, the plates do not fit in the top rack.  I have lost 3 plates to them falling off the rack into the sink. Otherwise it is a nicer rack and can hold a lot of items. We are a family of four so we have used it daily and that is my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: brandeebelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Size Dish Rack ESP. If You Don't Have A Dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: It never ceases to amaze me how many dirty dishes just two people can accumulate. I used to have two small dish racks in order to be able to dry all the dishes. They started to rust so I was looking for something that could just be one and done and replace them both. This thing is awesome. Plenty of storage and very sturdy. I'm glad the accessories can be rearranged, so you can really make it work to fit in your space. I'm not a huge fan of drainage/drying trays so I bought a large drying mat that fits perfectly underneath it. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Katreina

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack with good options for set up
customer_reviews.text: Really nice dishrack and well-made. It has lots of options for set-up and customizing. I have three suggestions, which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. 1) make the holder for utensils taller as longer utensils tend to fall over 2) extend the bottom rack a few inches to accommodate larger pots and pans 3) have some sort of upright bars on the bottom rack to help hold items, rather than having to always lay them flat
customer_reviews.author: Operasngr1

customer_reviews.title: so good. As absurd as it sounds
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. As absurd as it sounds, I've gone through 4 dish racks in the lat 4 months, trying to find one that fits our space but actually has room for dishes. This one is the best of what I've tried. The second tier is actually high enough to fit dishes underneath, nearly doubling the room for drying things. Ideal for dishes, a bit small for more than a single pot or pan. I can't give it 5 stars because I don't know yet how well it will hold up, but I'm happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I like that you can customize this to an extent. When I cook there are always several pots/pans and I wind up having a mountain of dishes piled up in the strainer. My husband claims that’s why he never does dishes because he doesn’t like piling up the dishes! 🤪 Sure. Anyway, so far so good. We will see when I get a large load of dishes and pots/pans to see if this was really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: This is a very bad product!
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and buy a drying rack from Target for 10$. I bought two of those racks and after only 2 weeks of use it gut rust everywhere! Ridiculous!!! And the plastic tray is too small to catch the water, also the water just sits there and doesn't drain. This is a very bad product!
customer_reviews.author: Jim E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack and excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: After 10 months of use, all I can say is that this rack is by far my favorite. It is sturdy, well designed, easy to assemble, easy to clean. It came with 2 draining boards. The smooth one broke while being cleaned and I contacted the seller. The response was very appropriate and they replaced it. I am extremely pleased with both my purchase and the company.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Great dish rack
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a two tier dish rack. This one caught my attention as it has a cutting board holder in the back. I use it mainly for the plastic cutting board but have used it for the full size wood cutting board and it held up well and never tipped over. There is also clips for cups, utensils, and knives! It holds a lot and doesn’t take up much surface area.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Not actually customizable
customer_reviews.text: I only got this because I was expecting this thing to be customizable but it isn't. The most customizable thing about this is whether you want you cutting boards or cup hangers to be on the right or left side. The utensil holders have this curved grip so you have to put them in specific spots. This is annoying because all that needed to be done to fix this, is to keep all the sides straight. I would never have bought it if I had known this. The only reason I'm not returning it is cause it would be a pain in the a** to put it back all in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Claypoole

customer_reviews.title: Very good except for draining issue
customer_reviews.text: Knife holder is surprisingly helpful! Plenty of capacity. Nice styling. The only issue is that the drainboard is totally flat, so the water just sits. No question that will cause nasty moldy water, so prepare to clean the drainboard regularly - or raise the "back" half of the board up with something to create an angle for water to drain.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is good quality but super annoying. It’s always falling apart. The second tier always comes off. It gets held in place by sticking the rod into the holes but it’s not sturdy and always comes out. The thing on the side to hold the cutting boards slip out as well. I constantly have to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very Pretty Rack!
customer_reviews.text: This stainless steel rack is very sturdy, great quality and works great. I love the appeal it adds to my counter and it will hold a lot of dishes and has a lot of little gadgets, like the drying rack for the knives. I love this piece. My knives all fit perfectly. I won't have to lay them down anymore like I did with my old dish rack . So far, customer service has been very helpful. Couldn't ask for more. The pictures on the listing in Amazon are exactly what you get, a beautiful, attractive rack. I am very happy with my purchase and I would definitely recommend this product and the company to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: This rack holds a lot of dishes and they dry much quicker than any rack I've purchased before. I would buy again. I like the versatility of the rack. I would prefer the drainage trays be made of a more durable rubber product than the present ones. It would also be convenient to purchase additional cup hooks to add to the three sent with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mlewis

customer_reviews.title: Works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: Yes, its a dish drainer. That being said, it's an awesome dish drainer. Its easy to put together, can swap configuration so it works best for you, very sturdy and large, yet doesn't take up a bigger footprint on the counter. Very thoughtfully designed and executed. Well made. Highly recommend if you need a dish drainer that's actually going to handle more than a glass or two at a time. Buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Be safe

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take up a lot of space, it's as big as any other one you buy at the box store, and it is customizable. The issue that I have with it, even though it's the reason why I got it, was the shelf part. It's good to because it gives extra space, but at the same time it takes away the space, which makes it both good and bad. You can stick cups and small things under the shelf part, but that's it. If you have bigger items to dry, the space that isn't the shelf is too small... Also the knife holder is inconvenient, and the sides holders for cups or something... Isn't ideal to hold much...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M. Park

customer_reviews.title: I love the style and versatility of this rack
customer_reviews.text: I love the style and versatility of this rack. It looks great on the counter and is totally functional. At first I was put off by the price but it is head and shoulders above any of its competitors. The quality is excellent! It holds the dishes securely in place and it holds a ton of assorted dinner ware and cooking utensils. It was a snap to assemble. The he only tiny, insignificant problem that I have encountered is that the microfiber mat is not wide enough to catch the drips from the glasses if you use the handy glass holder add-ones. I just put a small tea towel down. Kudos to the manufacturers of this dandy dish drying rack!
customer_reviews.author: KATHLEEN uNGER

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Components are easy to rearrange for personal use. Drain flow tray could be longer to reach further into sink (past mounting feet of rack) Comes with two drain trays (one to contain and one to allow flow to sink) and a drain pad. Instructions are photograph only - could explain better that dish rack inserts into plastic side supports.
customer_reviews.author: Rob M

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I love this dish rack. We had been limping along for years with one that was substandard and when we made a decision to upgrade, we chose this one. I couldn't be happier. It truly has a larger capacity, something we were looking for. It is a high grade stainless steel and has been battle tested for corrosion, not chrome coated like many with a similar look. There is a separate mount for cutting boards, lifting them up and out of the way and allowing for good air circulation for drying. And the knife rack cannot be beat. So many pluses, I cannot sing this enough praises.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. I've had different dish racks and none were ...
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. I've had different dish racks and none were quite right, became mildewed or rusty. Never holding enough nor letting the dishes, pots, pans, or silverware completely dry. The PremiumRacks Dish Rack - 304 is well made and configurable to suit my needs with separate glass, cutting board, and knife holders that attach to the dish rack. It comes with three different under rack pad and trays, I'm using all three.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Hi, my name is Michael, and I’m a dish in sink stacker. I keep meaning to do better but I always fall back to a sink full of dishes. This dish rack holds everything, far better than any I’ve tried before. It’s solid, well made, stainless steel, and easy to assemble. Yes, some assembly required, just plastic add-ons such as glass holders that you can place where they work for you. The two different levels are impressive. This thing is just wizards! I know I’ll never give stacking dishes now, it’s too much fun washing a sink full and finding space for all them plus still have room for more on the dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Good dish rack drainage not the best
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works well. Wish it sit off the counter a good in higher on one end and end side of sink that it was half an in higher to help with draining. The drip tray is designed for water to go off of to the side instead of draining in the center causing water to stand at the end with drainage. Half inserted as paper showed with one end higher than the other but it is not enough. Raising both ends and the opposite end even more helps. Other than that a great product that holds a lot of dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Makes better use of space.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two level dish racks before but the distance between levels was not optimal and it didn't have appropriate ways to organize your dishes. A couple things I wish on this one, though, is that the cup holders could hold thick-walled glasses/water bottles and that there were wires coming up that would allow for dishes to be stood up vertical. They tend to fall to the side.
customer_reviews.author: CootieBgg

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased a lot of dish racks, trying to find that perfect one. This one is it! It is large, yet smartly designed and holds a large number of dishes. The design maximize efficiency while not taking up too much counter space. I love all of the drip trays, and knife and ample utensil holders. A wonderful product that I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Krista P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Versatile design
customer_reviews.text: Component design makes for a very versatile product. The materials are sufficiently sturdy, but just so. Assembly instructions leave something to be desired. It takes looking VERY closely at several pictures to figure out some assembly details. In particular, with regard to the bottom trays, it is not clear if just one of the two trays should be used, or both. And the (important) detail for sloping the bottom tray is separate and not particularly clear. All said, i would recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: eneuf

customer_reviews.title: Cleverly designed and holds a lot of dishes.
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned at first with flimsiness of wires compared with my home one but i’m Pleased by the capacity of this rack for our second home. The double racks with plates on top means it holds a lot of dishes. Annoying that there are only 3 holders on the side for glasses or cups. The deep side attachment is great for cutting boards, baking sheets or pot lids. I actually like the compartment for knives.
customer_reviews.author: cyssf

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with cracked drainboard
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that this rack has a lot of room, and hopefully it will wear well because it is stainless steel (it is still new). One of the trays we received arrived chipped. Overall, the plastic parts are not high quality. Seller should use a higher level of product quality assurance so that customers do not receive broken parts. The seller quickly replaced the drainboard. The drainboard does not drain well: water pools in one end of it.
customer_reviews.author: nora

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to replacing my old dish drainer, mainly because it started to rust. This new dish rack is well designed and has everything that I wanted. An area for utensils and an area to store knives. The only problem I had putting together was placing the plastic parts on the unit. Since I have very small hands that have a touch of arthritis, it became difficult to snap on the unit. There is a trick to making it easier. Just warm up the plastic parts with hot water and then snap on with no fuss or muss! Good product with lots of room!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Like the size and the tiers to provide extra room. Does have a large footprint, especiallyif you use all of the "accessories". You'll want to make sure to take that into consideration - I'm not using the knife block and another piece so I've made it work for me. Highly recommend watching videos before putting together so you don't snap and break plastic parts.
customer_reviews.author: AME

customer_reviews.title: Unusual
customer_reviews.text: First of all it was very difficult to put together. I am returning it mainly because I cracked a bowl going to put it in to the drainer, because the drainer is metal. I’m used to a plastic drainer. I don’t know if this is something I could’ve gotten used toBut I’m not taking any more chances with more dishes breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Parlin Seegers

customer_reviews.title: Exceed my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dush dryer because until now the previous ones came from Walmart or whatever store was convenient for me. I love the ease of installation, the ability to customize, the levels to dry everything apart from each other...and the stainless steel that hopefully keeps from rusting! Mist of all I'm glad it's made in the US!
customer_reviews.author: DoxieLover

customer_reviews.title: Not a simple rack
customer_reviews.text: Glasses do not stay on the clips well. My drinking glasses pop off. I had one glass crack after popping off one too many times. The knife drying attachment is nice if it would only stay attached. I am glad I don't need the second level, because I could not get it to work well. I would not recommend this
customer_reviews.author: John Y.

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: it’s annoying that the water doesn’t empty out from the bottom tray. I had to put a piece of wood on the bottom to slant it toward the sink. I also have to push down on the tray so that the water empties. It didn’t have a instruction manual so that it shows you how your suppose to build the dish rack so that the water empties.
customer_reviews.author: AL212NY

customer_reviews.title: Right size and nice looking.....
customer_reviews.text: Item came in a timely manner... When I received the item that came in a box I thought is was going to be too small for what I wanted. After putting it together I found it was just right. Even though many of the connections are plastic, they are a sturdy plastic. I am happy with the product....
customer_reviews.author: GET SUM

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! Best purchase ever! At first I didn't like the price, thought it was too much for a dish wrack. Its flexible and easy to put together. Holds a lot of dishes, way more than I thought. Its Very sturdy. It looks very nice in the kitchen. You have multiple ways to put it together to fit your liking. On other reviews people didn't know what to do with the micro fiber mat, I use it for extra dishes. I typically don't leave reviews because I'm not on anyone's marketing team. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: mykah

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed, felt 4x to expensive
customer_reviews.text: The pics lead you to believe it offers a lot for the money, but its just a wire rack with plastic bits and pieces. It came off as flimsy and I think I returned my unit for the second time because it felt like it was repacked by someone else. There has to be better out there for $59.
customer_reviews.author: Badvhlad

customer_reviews.title: Great for Storage
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this dish rack. I’ve been washing dishes since I was 7 (I’m 34 now!) and this is the best one I’ve ever come across! The different compartments make storage and retrieving dishes easy. I think my husband broke one dish, but the children and I haven’t broken any! I love the separate knife and cutting board sections as well. Now my mom wants one! Takes a few minutes to put together so don’t get discouraged...it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Safi

customer_reviews.title: The counter is always wet.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is good but the drip tray setup is silly. the tray underneath is too small and has a bump in the middle on the drain side which holds the water on the tray. The side trays don't catch everything (water falls between them and the tray underneath. They also don't drain. The counter gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: SheaLea

customer_reviews.title: Love the versatility
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I am quite happy with our PremiumRacks Professional Dish Rack. It is sturdy and easy to change the format to accommodate the dishes being washed. My only beef is that despite putting the catch pan underneath at the angle they proscribe, it catches the water in the bottom left and right corners and leaves standing water. There is also standing water left in the utensil holder, despite the drain holes. Also, the dish mat that comes with it is too small to catch water that drips from the cutting board holder and glass holders. I purchased a larger dish mat to solve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas A Kallman

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it, but I didn't
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love it, but I didn't. Poor instructions. No rubber on feet, so it slides. Drip tray mounts under, but does not extend quite to the sides, so anything near the edge of the rack leaves water on the counter. It is compact, holds quite a bit and can be configured a couple of different ways. I returned it, since the primary goal was to not have water on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Dame

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but...
customer_reviews.text: Product has many great features. It holds a lot. It is sturdy. It was easy to put together. But, it has two faults. First, the glass holders hold only thin glasses, not mugs or thick glasses. Second, the drain board is smaller than the drain rack. There are two "side drainage systems" included. But they only prevent dripping onto the counter, they do not drain into the sink. I solved the problem by buying a large drain board the holds the whole drain rack.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene T.

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. The drip tray underneath pulls out so ...
customer_reviews.text: This rack is quite large so take measurements to be sure it will fit where you want it. You will also need space below any cupboards if you want to put tall items on the top rack. I really like it. The drip tray underneath pulls out so the water can be poured off. The knife holder is great as is the cutting board holder on the side. This is great!
customer_reviews.author: MaryW

customer_reviews.title: Looks good on my kitchen counter and hold lots of dishes.
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack arrived in good shape. The packaging was well thought out. I put the pieces together in no time and decided upon which direction i wanted to place the rack with the assembled pieces. So far so good - i hope that it remains in good shape and does not rust. Overall I am very satisfied with this dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: VET

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Dish Rack with Premium Service
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as advertised. However, unforeseen issues included: 1) the wireframe gauge is thinner than my last rack, 2) the upper and lower level racks are joined by plastic connectors. And, 3) not so obvious in the photo are the curved wire rims designed to only accept the plastic knife holder and rear plastic utensil holder (the curved edge disallows substitutions like adding third party metal utensil holders). If this was my first rack I might have kept it. On the other hand, the customer service supporting these products is superb, offering a refund or exchange as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Great rack design, small quality issue
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great. It's design is very flexible and it has lots of room for dishes. It also seems very durable. Unfortunately, the trays designed to go under the rack are not very well made. The plastic is thin and brittle. In fact, one of them arrived with a broken corner. I'm still using the rack, which itself looks very well made. It's just a small frustration not to have a water tight tray to catch the drips.
customer_reviews.author: M. V. W.

customer_reviews.title: expensive for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack definitely worth the extra bucks. I was skeptical to spend so much money on a dish rack, but i decided to do so after reading all the positive review. I am glad I did. My husband, who does the dishes are very pleased with my purchase. The quality is way better than my previous dish racks that I got from target and IKEA. The second level is a bonus for me. I use it to dry all my baby bottles and nipples. I can get rid of my baby bottle rack to save counter space. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael L

customer_reviews.title: Good dishrack overall
customer_reviews.text: Decent dishrack overall. Easy to put together and several options to add pieces to suit your own needs. Looks nice too. It has one major drawback/design flaw. The draining board sits flat rather than on a slight angle. As a result the water pools and does not drain off. You have to physically lift one end of the rack to get the water to drain out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fremlin

customer_reviews.title: Chinsy
customer_reviews.text: Meh! I wanted a stainless steel sturdy good looking rack! This is not that! It is assembled ( by you) from many crappy pieces and holds well enough when loaded but the pieces are thin metal and plastic and not very good looking for something that sits next to your sink all day long -and it’s exoensive for what I got! I’m going to keep looking in stores because this was a deceiving presentation online
customer_reviews.author: Kimba

customer_reviews.title: So customizable!
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can clip everything where you want it to be so that it fits your kitchen setup. Pros: super customizable easy setup looks great sturdy high quality the drying towel is very large and nice looking Cons: the drain tray doesn't work a bit expensive the knife attachment doesn't quite fit my Wüsthof
customer_reviews.author: Tim Shinn

customer_reviews.title: Sexy tank of a dish rack makes mama v. Happy
customer_reviews.text: This is a tank of a dish rack. Sturdy pieces that clip on snug and hold a lot. The top piece seems like it would be loose and unsupportive the way it attatches but holds weight well. There is so much space on this thing. I've never been so aroused by a dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: BB jones

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of dishes
customer_reviews.text: One of the best dish racks I have purchased to date. I had a Simple Human brand prior to this dish rack and prefer the Premium Rack for the extra space and the cutting board drying rack. Prem Rack holds a lot of dishes and is easy to put together. Down side is the drain pans are black and hard water stains show right away. The cup holders are too tightly set to the rack and cannot hold just any glass, but that is o.k., there is plenty of room under the 2nd rack to place cups and standard glasses. Overall the positives out way the couple of negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Me Too

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Wish I’d had this 30 years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Never had a drainboard like this one. Although the parts appear small, flimsy, and hard to assemble, the board is very sturdy when put together. I’m surprised how much it holds too. Our full dishwasher had to be emptied so that a repair could be made; this double-decker drainboard held almost the full load! It’s well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: HughesNughes

customer_reviews.title: Too small for me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't save much space unless you have more plates than bowls. I have more bowls than plates. I think $60 is too high for what you get to be honest. $30 would have been more reasonable. I would return it but the hassle is just too big. For me personally, it is ultimately a waste of money for me because it didn't save space and in fact it took up just as much horizontal space but even more vertical space!
customer_reviews.author: esseyo

customer_reviews.title: Love at first dry!
customer_reviews.text: I did not know I could love a dish rack as much I this but I do! The greatest benefit I have experienced is that I now no longer use the entire counter to dry dishes. The bottom tray that pulls out makes it super convenient for drying large pots and pans. Being able to put knives in dedicated slots allows me to avoid mixing them in with the other utensils and cutting myself too.
customer_reviews.author: Letara Vellos

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this one. We'd been looking for a new dish rack/drainboard for a while. In my searches I'd seen this one, but thought $60 for this item was too much. I finally pulled the trigger and am glad I did! It was easy to assemble and even gives you options (left or right side of sink). I like the knife feature and place for the cutting board. Only reason I gave 4 (not 5) stars is that the water does pool a bit on the drain board and that I've only had it a week so I can't verify if it will rust or not.
customer_reviews.author: robert fullmer

customer_reviews.title: Drainage trey came warped.
customer_reviews.text: The drainage trey came warped so it doesn't allow for all the water to fall into the sink. Instead it collects in the corners. Everything else functions as expected. The trey could have been warped during shipping. I live in Las Vegas, and things tend to melt in transport.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REAL stainless steel. One of the BEST quality racks around!
customer_reviews.text: We tried many racks prior that claimed to be stainless steel, but they end up rusting- some even within days! Except this one! We've had it for a month now and it is still good as new. Don't underestimate the versatility of this rack and how much items you can put on here to dry at the same time! We really love it, price is a little bit higher than others around, but it is worth it for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of dishes
customer_reviews.text: I love the extra height and the knife slots. Holds all my dishes. Only thing I don’t like is the cup holders - they are too big/fat to hold a lot of my cups. The cups won’t go far enough down on the holder thing to stay upright, and they fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not impressive
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like the look or feel of this rack. The stainless steel parts are thinner than i expected. My old kitchenaid rack looks better and is more substantive. I was hoping this would be able handle more dishes given its second tier but no.
customer_reviews.author: eid8801

customer_reviews.title: Spacious and safety
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this dry rack. I like having the top rack for dishes and the bottom gets freed up for everything else. The side holder for the cutting board is perfect since my boards are small. And having the rack for the knives on top with the dish section is greats because it keeps the knives secure and away from my kids who sometimes grab utensils from the old rack and knives would be in there too. So far it has not rusted and the bottom drainage trays are good and have not given me any issues. I am very satisfied with the item. As long as it doesn’t rust I am a happy camper. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: heidi A delgado

customer_reviews.title: Space saving, High quality
customer_reviews.text: Compared a few dish racks on amazon and this one was worth the extra money. I love the second level, ease in customization, quality and look of this product. I'm pretty impatient when it comes to installation, so appreciated how easy it was to set up and re-adjust for personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: beautiful dish rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. especially the fact that it is stainless steel and will not rust EVER. it was expensive but will be worth it if it lives up to the promises the makers make. it is larger than my old one and will hold more dishes. I really love that. I also like the separate knife holder. this it a real safety factor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The dish rack of my dreams
customer_reviews.text: It’s got a ton of space and designated areas for everything. I used to have to use two separate drying racks for all my wet dishes but now I only need this one. The water drains right into the sink and I’ve seen no rust so far with heavy daily usage. Just perfect!
customer_reviews.author: stQ

customer_reviews.title: Best One By Far
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are split on this but I absolutely love it. You definitely have to be strategic on where you put things but I have found that I am able to put a lot of dishes in it and customize it to my needs. The directions are garbage though because there are no written directions just a picture or two. I was able to figure it out by looking at the photos that people have posted here in the reviews. I have recommended this to several family members and they love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to spend this much on a dish rack. I'd had the same 'ol Bamboo rack for like 6 years. I liked the natural look of Bamboo but it got kinda gross after a bit, and I knew it was time for retirement. After reading a lot of reviews, I took the plunge. Well, I love it! Having the compartment for knives is useful, as is the cutting board rack/slot. It's a good size, and I believe it will be easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: POOR DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: not only are the drain boards smaller than the rack, they're NOT even sloped to allow it to drain.
customer_reviews.author: al p

customer_reviews.title: lost of space and well configured
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Very functional and useful design. Also very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Design
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best dish rack I've ever owned. It's well worth the price, the quality is superb. Even the plastic parts are solid and durable-looking. -High quality materials all around. -The design maximizes the usability of the footprint: it's no bigger than my previous dish rack but holds probably twice as many dishes. -The top rack feels solid, even when loaded with ceramic plates or cups. One of my main concerns when I bought this was that the space underneath the top rack would not be easily accessible and usable, but I've found the opposite to be true. -The accessories are all durable and useful.
customer_reviews.author: AlexTheAlex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product with Superior Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this item to replace an old worn out dish rack. It perfectly matches the decor of my kitchen's stainless appliances and new quartz countertops. In addition to the rack, it comes with a matching plastic drainboard and microfiber towel. All pretty sturdy and very nice looking. The rack can be rearranged to suit your personal preferences, so it's easy to make it work in a variety of situations. The drainboard piece initially arrived cracked, but when I contacted the company, they immediately shipped out a replacement, along with an additional item for my troubles. A+ for customer service!
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: The product blurb about impressing your friends with your dish drainer is funny, but the product is good. The breadboard rack and knife holders are good ideas. So is the double-deck arrangement. It seems to me the drain pan should be bigger; it has a slightly smaller footprint than the rack. But that doesn't seem to cause a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Less space than it looks like
customer_reviews.text: Hard to utilize that lower rack under the top rack. Ends up being wasted space.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P

customer_reviews.title: A well designed rack
customer_reviews.text: Although I did nt need all the features, (knife rack, drain pan, two black shelves) the remaining parts are all my kitchen needed! Enough room for a small family of plates, and spaced so bowls don't topple over. Small enough to keep kitchen tidy and organized, and stainless steel is a must!! (my last rack was chromed, which bubbled and rusted) . I recommend highly .
customer_reviews.author: Lisza Christine

customer_reviews.title: Great customizable set-up; sloping drip tray doesn’t drain as well as it should.
customer_reviews.text: Got this highly rates dish rack to replace a badly rusting one that I had. It’s a little bulky for my kitchen countertop but i like it that the accessories are customizable - i can clip it to fit my ergonomics. Due to the size of my countertop I could not use all the accessories that came with it but I can keep it should my configuration change down the road. The only thing I didn’t like is the sloping drip tray doesn’t drain as well as I like it to be. I have to keep pressing the tray to let the water drain. Other than that I’m happy with it and I hope rust doesn’t set in!
customer_reviews.author: Fiona Lim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to customize and strudy
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews, but I'm very happy about this purchase. I've been looking for some time when my step daughter threw out the last dish drying rack out because of rust. I was hesitant about buying this one because of the price. But if it was good quality and if doesn't rust (we'll see) than I decided it would be worth it. I'm surprised at how happy I can be about a dish drying rack. It was easy to put together and sturdy. I feel like they thought of everything with this product, from a place to put a cutting board or cookie sheet to hanging glasses on the side. There is room for all our dishes.
customer_reviews.author: KIM KARDOS

customer_reviews.title: Knife does not drain properly and drainage tray is damage.
customer_reviews.text: Overall design is very good. Only bad thing is that the knife drainage doesn't flow properly. The water will spill out and does not go into the bottom plate. It's easy to fix but apparently no one tested the water flow of this when they design it. I had to put the cup holder tray under the knife to catch the water spill. Another thing, during shipping the drainage tray is bend so now the water gets stuck near the utensils until more water comes down to push it out. They package it very carefully so the only way this can happen is pre packaging during assembly. Can you send me another drainage tray?
customer_reviews.author: Phung V.

customer_reviews.title: Really is the best rack around we can find
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift, but my wife was so excited, she made me open it up and set it up. We are a small family and do not own or wish to own an automatic dishwasher. This choice has been made difficult by very poor dish racks in the past. This rack by PremiumRacks is the best rack we have ever seen for functionality and capacity. It looks to be worth every penny. I thought it was useful that many of the components can be repositioned depending on your counter set up. Can't wait to give this to our son for his new home.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bock

customer_reviews.title: I love this rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack! I love the basket for the flatware, it is long so spacious. The design is just so smart, it holds the cutting boards and the knives in separate compartments making the rest of the space more useful, it even holds 3 cups also in separate units. It is so well designed that without using too much space it holds everything and it looks beautiful! I am very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Luz

customer_reviews.title: Great product with exceptional customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dish rack one month ago and it is working out well. The overall quality is very good. I like how you can customize the layout. It holds quite a lot. It is quite sturdy on the whole. As mentioned in some of the earlier reviews, the plastic parts can break fairly easily (which is why I took a star off for sturdiness). I accidentally broke a plastic part and requested a replacement. Customer service was incredibly friendly and they replaced the part right away. (Big thanks!!) I would definitely buy this again and would recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Best dish rack I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: After finally throwing out my moldy bamboo dish rack, which was nice to look at but not functional, I discovered this beauty. So functional, with different compartments for all your dishes, glass, utensils etc. The easy to pull out drain trays underneath the stainless steel racks are fantastic. It means no longer do I have to put a towel underneath to catch the water run off and then have to remove a sopping wet towel. The side compartment to hold a thin cutting board is also great. A lot of thought has gone into this design, and I can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Byrne

product_meta.title: PremiumRacks Professional Dish Rack - 304 Stainless Steel - Fully Customizable - Microfiber Mat Included - Modern Design - Large Capacity
feature_bullets: FULLY CUSTOMIZABLE- With two different style drainboards, a microfiber mat, three separate cup holder attachments & a cutting board attachment that can be placed at your choosing. The top shelf of the unit can be flipped from side to side, moved from front to back, or taken off completely, totally up to you. It also comes with a wide utensil holder and a knife holder attachment which can have its top removed to hold sponges or more utensils. All units now come with new side drainage (see video).

304 STAINLESS STEEL- This dish rack is made of a high quality 304 stainless steel. This high grade 304 stainless steel has excellent resistance to a wide range of atmospheric environments (coastal areas) and can withstand corrosion from most oxidizing acids. That durability makes 304 easy to sanitize, and therefore ideal for kitchen and food applications. This high-grade stainless steel will prevent rust and will last through the roughest of conditions. The product passed a 24-hour salt test.

PERFECT TO IMPRESS YOUR GUESTS- Yes, quality does matter! (especially when you are trying to impress someone) Don't just get another cheap dish rack. Get one that will last a lifetime and will provide value to your family.
BUILT TOUGH- We made this dish drainer as sturdy as can be. Don't worry about a wobbly top shelf, our dish rack is built tough and will not break
SIZE MATTERS- Perfection can come in all different shapes and sizes, including this bigger than average dish rack measuring @ 18" long x 11.5" tall x 13" wide (21" with side drainage system)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,875 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
